# GitHub Discussions Setup Instructions

## How to Enable Discussions

1. Go to your repository: https://github.com/dontmindme369/ARIA
2. Click **Settings** tab
3. Scroll to **Features** section
4. Check âœ… **Discussions**
5. Click **Set up discussions**

## Welcome Post

After enabling Discussions, create a pinned welcome post using the content from `DISCUSSIONS_WELCOME.md`.

### Steps:
1. Go to **Discussions** tab
2. Click **New discussion**
3. Category: **General**
4. Title: **Welcome to ARIA Discussions! ğŸŒ€**
5. Copy content from `DISCUSSIONS_WELCOME.md`
6. Post discussion
7. Click **â‹¯** (three dots) â†’ **Pin discussion**

## Category Emojis

To add emojis to category names:
1. Go to **Settings** â†’ **Discussions**
2. Edit each category
3. Add emoji to the beginning of the name

Example: `ğŸ’¬ General`, `ğŸ’¡ Ideas`, `ğŸ™‹ Q&A`

## Moderation Settings

Recommended settings:
- âœ… Allow anyone to create discussions
- âœ… Allow reactions on discussions
- âœ… Allow discussion comments
- âœ… Lock discussions after 180 days of inactivity
- âœ… Enable discussion templates (optional)

## Discussion Templates (Optional)

Create `.github/DISCUSSION_TEMPLATE/` folder with:
- `feature_request.yml`
- `show_and_tell.yml`
- `research.yml`

See GitHub's [discussion templates documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/communities/using-templates-to-encourage-useful-issues-and-pull-requests/syntax-for-discussion-templates).
